title: JSON Schema for Beef Entity code-generation (https://github.com/Avanade/Beef).

CodeGeneration.title: 'CodeGeneration' object (entity-driven)
CodeGeneration.description: The `CodeGeneration` object defines global properties that are used to drive the underlying entity-driven code generation.

withResult.title: Indicates whether to use `CoreEx.Results` (aka Railway-oriented programming).
withResult.description: Defaults to `true`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s) and/or `Operation`(s).

preprocessorDirectives.title: Indicates whether to use preprocessor directives in the generated output.

refDataNamespace.title: The namespace for the Reference Data entities (adds as a c# `using` statement).

refDataCommonNamespace.title: The namespace for the Reference Data common entities (adds as a c# `using` statement).

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data `Property` for an `Entity`.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API `Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`). This can be further configured on the `Entity` and for each `Property`.

refDataType.title: The Reference Data identifier Type option.
refDataType.description: Required to identify an entity as being Reference Data. Specifies the underlying .NET Type used for the Reference Data identifier. Results in all underlying entities becoming Reference Data.

refDataWebApiRoute.title: The `RouteAtttribute` for the Reference Data Web API controller required for named pre-fetching. The `WebApiRoutePrefix` will be prepended where specified.

refDataDataCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-inferred) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated `ReferenceDataData` constructor.
refDataDataCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. Where the `Type` matches an already inferred value it will be ignored.

jsonSerializer.title: The JSON Serializer to use for JSON property attribution.
jsonSerializer.description: Defaults to `SystemText`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

etagJsonName.title: The default JSON name for the `ETag` property.
etagJsonName.description: Defaults to `etag`. Note that the `JsonName` can be set individually per property where required.

usingNamespace1.title: The additional Namespace using statement to be added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace1.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

usingNamespace2.title: The additional Namespace using statement to be added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace2.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

usingNamespace3.title: The additional Namespace using statement to be added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace3.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s) and/or their corresponding `Operation`(s).

webApiAutoLocation.title: Indicates whether the HTTP Response Location Header route (`Operation.WebApiLocation`) is automatically inferred.
webApiAutoLocation.description: This will automatically set the `Operation.WebApiLocation` for an `Operation` named `Create` where there is a corresponding named `Get`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

webApiRoutePrefix.title: The base (prefix) `URI` prepended to all `Operation.WebApiRoute` values.

webApiTags.title: The list of tags to add for the generated `WebApi`.
webApiTags.description: This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s) and/or their corresponding `Operation`(s).

managerCleanUp.title: Indicates whether a `Cleaner.Cleanup` is performed for the operation parameters within the Manager-layer.
managerCleanUp.description: This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s) and `Operation`(s).

validationFramework.title: The `Validation` framework to use for the entity-based validation.
validationFramework.description: Defaults to `CoreEx` (literal). This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s), `Operation`(s) and `Parameter`(s).

autoImplement.title: The data source auto-implementation option.
autoImplement.description: Defaults to `None`. Indicates that the implementation for the underlying `Operations` will be auto-implemented using the selected data source (unless explicitly overridden). When selected some of the related attributes will also be required (as documented). Additionally, the `AutoImplement` can be further specified/overridden per `Operation`.

databaseType.title: The .NET database type and optional name (used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database`).
databaseType.description: Defaults to `IDatabase`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IDatabase^Db`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

databaseProvider.title: The default database schema name.
databaseProvider.description: Defaults to `SqlServer`. Enables specific database provider functionality/formatting/etc. where applicable.

databaseMapperEx.title: Indicates that a `DatabaseMapperEx` will be used; versus, `DatabaseMapper` (which uses Reflection internally).
databaseMapperEx.description: Defaults to `true`. The `DatabaseMapperEx` essentially replaces the `DatabaseMapper` as it is more performant (extended/explicit); this option can be used where leagcy/existing behavior is required.

entityFrameworkType.title: The .NET Entity Framework type and optional name (used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`).
entityFrameworkType.description: Defaults to `IEfDb`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IEfDb^Ef`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

cosmosType.title: The .NET Cosmos DB type and name (used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`).
cosmosType.description: Defaults to `ICosmosDb`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `ICosmosDb^Cosmos`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

odataType.title: The .NET OData interface name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataType.description: Defaults to `IOData`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IOData^OData`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

httpAgentType.title: The default .NET HTTP Agent interface name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.
httpAgentType.description: Defaults to `IHttpAgent`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IHttpAgent^HttpAgent`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

etagDefaultMapperConverter.title: The default ETag to/from RowVersion column Mapping Converter used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database` or `EntityFramework`.

refDataDefaultMapperConverter.title: The default Reference Data property `Converter` used by the generated `Mapper`(s) where not specifically defined.
refDataDefaultMapperConverter.description: Defaults to `ReferenceDataCodeConverter<T>`. Where this value is suffixed by `<T>` or `{T}` this will automatically be set to the `Type`.

eventPublish.title: The layer to add logic to publish an event for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to `DataSvc`. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHub, ServiceBus, SignalR, etc. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

eventSourceRoot.title: The URI root for the event source by prepending to all event source URIs.
eventSourceRoot.description: The event source is only updated where an `EventSourceKind` is not `None`. This can be extended within the `Entity`(s).

eventSourceKind.title: The URI kind for the event source URIs.
eventSourceKind.description: Defaults to `None` (being the event source is not updated).

eventSubjectRoot.title: The root for the event Subject name by prepending to all event subject names.
eventSubjectRoot.description: Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHub, ServiceBus, SignalR, etc. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

eventSubjectSeparator.title: The subject path separator.
eventSubjectSeparator.description: Defaults to `.`. Used only where the subject is automatically inferred.

eventActionFormat.title: The formatting for the Action when an Event is published.
eventActionFormat.description: Defaults to `None` (no formatting required, i.e. as-is)`.

eventTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `DataSvc`-layer whereever generating event publishing logic.
eventTransaction.description: Usage will force a rollback of any underlying data transaction (where the provider supports TransactionScope) on failure, such as an `EventPublish` error. This is by no means implying a Distributed Transaction (DTC) should be invoked; this is only intended for a single data source that supports a TransactionScope to guarantee reliable event publishing. Defaults to `false`. This essentially defaults the `Entity.EventTransaction` where not otherwise specified. This should only be used where `EventPublish` is `DataSvc` and a transactionally-aware data source is being used.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model. Must be set to `true` for any of the subordinate gRPC capabilities to be code-generated. Will require each `Entity`, and corresponding `Property` and `Operation` to be opted-in specifically.

pathBase.title: The base path (directory) prefix for the artefacts; other `Path*` properties append to this value when they are not specifically overridden.
pathBase.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo`.

pathCommon.title: The path (directory) for the Database-related artefacts.

pathBusiness.title: The path (directory) for the Business-related (.NET) artefacts.

pathApi.title: The path (directory) for the API-related (.NET) artefacts.

namespaceBase.title: The base Namespace (root) for the .NET artefacts.
namespaceBase.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo`.

namespaceCommon.title: The Namespace (root) for the Common-related .NET artefacts.

namespaceBusiness.title: The Namespace (root) for the Business-related .NET artefacts.

namespaceApi.title: The Namespace (root) for the Api-related .NET artefacts.

authActionRead.title: The default `Operation.AuthAction` for an `Operation.Type` of `Get` or `GetColl`.

Entity.title: 'Entity' object (entity-driven)
Entity.description: The `Entity` is used as the primary configuration for driving the entity-driven code generation.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: Overrides the Name (as sentence text) for the summary comments. It will be formatted as: `Represents the {Text} entity.`. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

fileName.title: The overriding file name.
fileName.description: Overrides the Name as the code-generated file name.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

constType.title: The Const .NET Type option.
constType.description: The .NET Type to be used for the `const` values. Defaults to `string`.

isInitialOverride.title: Indicates whether to override the `IInitial.IsInitial` property.
isInitialOverride.description: Set to either `true` or `false` to override as specified; otherwise, `null` to check each property. Defaults to `null`.

withResult.title: Indicates whether to use `CoreEx.Results` (aka Railway-oriented programming).
withResult.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.WithResult`. This can be overridden within the Operation`(s).

refDataType.title: The Reference Data identifier Type option.
refDataType.description: Required to identify an entity as being Reference Data. Specifies the underlying .NET Type used for the Reference Data identifier.

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data `Property` overriding the `CodeGeneration.RefDataText` selection.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API`Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`). Defaults from `CodeGeneration.RefDataText`.

refDataSortOrder.title: The Reference Data sort order option.
refDataSortOrder.description: Specifies the default sort order for the underlying Reference Data collection. Defaults to `SortOrder`.

inherits.title: The base class that the entity inherits from.
inherits.description: Defaults to `EntityBase` for a standard entity. For Reference Data it will default to `ReferenceDataBaseEx<xxx>` depending on the corresponding `RefDataType` value. See `OmitEntityBase` if the desired outcome is to not inherit from any of the aforementioned base classes.

implements.title: The list of comma separated interfaces that are to be declared for the entity class.

implementsAutoInfer.title: Indicates whether to automatically infer the interface implements for the entity from the properties declared.
implementsAutoInfer.description: Will attempt to infer the following: `IIdentifier<Guid>`, `IIdentifier<int>`, `IIdentifier<long>`, `IIdentifier<string>`, `IETag` and `IChangeLog`. Defaults to `true`.

abstract.title: Indicates whether the class should be defined as abstract.

genericWithT.title: Indicates whether the class should be defined as a generic with a single parameter `T`.

namespace.title: The entity namespace to be appended.
namespace.description: Appended to the end of the standard structure as follows: `{Company}.{AppName}.Business.Entities.{Namespace}`.

omitEntityBase.title: Indicates that the entity should not inherit from `EntityBase`.
omitEntityBase.description: As such any of the `EntityBase` related capabilites are not supported (are omitted from generation). The intention for this is more for the generation of simple internal entities.

jsonSerializer.title: The JSON Serializer to use for JSON property attribution.
jsonSerializer.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.JsonSerializer` configuration property where specified; otherwise, `SystemText`.

internalOnly.title: Indicates whether the entity is for internal use only; declared in Business entities only.

collection.title: Indicates whether a corresponding entity collection class should be created.

collectionResult.title: Indicates whether a corresponding entity collection result class should be created
collectionResult.description: Enables the likes of additional paging state to be stored with the underlying collection.

collectionType.title: The entity collection type used where `CollectionInherits` is not specified.

collectionInherits.title: The base class that a `Collection` inherits from.
collectionInherits.description: Defaults to `EntityBaseCollection` or `EntityBaseKeyedCollection` depending on `CollectionKeyed`. For Reference Data it will default to `ReferenceDataCollectionBase`.

collectionResultInherits.title: The base class that a `CollectionResult` inherits from.

behavior.title: Defines the key CRUD-style behavior (operation types), being 'C'reate, 'G'et (or 'R'ead), 'U'pdate, 'P'atch, 'D'elete and `Q`uery). Additionally, `GetByArgs` ('B'), `GetAll` ('A') and `GetByQuery` ('Q') operations configuration will be automatically inferred where not otherwise explicitly specified.
behavior.description: Value may only specifiy one or more of the `CGRUDBAQ` characters (in any order) to define the automatically generated behavior (operations); for example: `CRUPD` or `CRUP` or `rba` (case insensitive). This is shorthand for setting one or more of the following properties: `Get`, `GetByArgs`, `GetAll`, 'Create', `Update`, `Patch` and `Delete`. Where one of these properties is set to either `true` or `false` this will take precedence over the value set for `Behavior`.

get.title: Indicates that a `Get` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

getByArgs.title: Indicates that a `GetByArgs` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

getAll.title: Indicates that a `GetAll` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

getByQuery.title: Indicates that a `GetByQuery` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

create.title: Indicates that a `Create` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

update.title: Indicates that a `Update` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

patch.title: Indicates that a `Patch` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

delete.title: Indicates that a `Delete` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

autoImplement.title: The data source auto-implementation option.
autoImplement.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.AutoImplement` (where `RefDataType` or `EntityFrameworkModel` or `CosmosModel` or `HttpAgent` is not null; otherwise, `None`. Indicates that the implementation for the underlying `Operations` will be auto-implemented using the selected data source (unless explicitly overridden). When selected some of the related attributes will also be required (as documented). Additionally, the `AutoImplement` can be further specified/overridden per `Operation`.

dataCtor.title: The access modifier for the generated `Data` constructor.

dataCtorCustom.title: Indicates whether the `Data` constructor will be implemented as custom; i.e. not generated.

dataCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-inferred) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated `Data` constructor.
dataCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. Where the `Type` matches an already inferred value it will be ignored.

dataExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Data` extensions logic should be generated.

refDataStoredProcedureName.title: The Reference Data database stored procedure name.

databaseType.title: The .NET database type and optional name (used where `AutoImplement` is `Database`).
databaseType.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.DatabaseName` configuration property (its default value is `IDatabase`). Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`.

databaseSchema.title: The database schema name (used where `AutoImplement` is `Database`).

databaseMapperInheritsFrom.title: The name of the `Mapper` that the generated Database `Mapper` inherits from.

databaseCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Database `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
databaseCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

databaseMapperEx.title: Indicates that a `DatabaseMapperEx` (extended/explicit) will be used; versus, `DatabaseMapper` (which uses Reflection internally).
databaseMapperEx.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.DatabaseMapperEx` (its default value is `true`). The `DatabaseMapperEx` essentially replaces the `DatabaseMapper` as it is more performant; this option can be used where leagcy/existing behavior is required.

entityFrameworkType.title: The .NET Entity Framework type and optyional name used where `AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`.
entityFrameworkType.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.EntityFrameworkName`. Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`.

entityFrameworkModel.title: The corresponding Entity Framework model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`).

entityFrameworkCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Entity Framework `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
entityFrameworkCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

entityFrameworkMapperBase.title: The EntityFramework data-layer name that should be used for base mappings.

cosmosType.title: The .NET Cosmos DB type and optional name used where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.
cosmosType.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.CosmosName` configuration property (its default value is `ICosmosDb`). Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`.

cosmosModel.title: The corresponding Cosmos model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`).

cosmosPartitionKey.title: The C# code to be used for setting the optional Cosmos `PartitionKey` where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.
cosmosPartitionKey.description: The value `PartitionKey.None` can be specified. Literals will need to be quoted.

cosmosValueContainer.title: Indicates whether the `CosmosDbValueContainer` is to be used; otherwise, `CosmosDbContainer`.

cosmosCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Cosmos `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
cosmosCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

cosmosMapperBase.title: The Cosmos data-layer name that should be used for base mappings.

odataType.title: The .NET OData type and optional name used where `AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataType.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.ODataName` configuration property (its default value is `IOData`). Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`.

odataModel.title: The corresponding OData model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `OData`).

odataCollectionName.title: The name of the underlying OData collection where `AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataCollectionName.description: The underlying `Simple.OData.Client` will attempt to infer.

odataCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom OData `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
odataCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

httpAgentType.title: The .NET HTTP Agent type and optional name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.
httpAgentType.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.HttpAgentName` configuration property (its default value is `IHttpAgent`). Should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`.

httpAgentRoutePrefix.title: The base HTTP Agent API route where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.
httpAgentRoutePrefix.description: This is the base (prefix) `URI` for the HTTP Agent endpoint and can be further extended when defining the underlying `Operation`(s).

httpAgentModel.title: The corresponding HTTP Agent model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`).
httpAgentModel.description: This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s).

httpAgentReturnModel.title: The corresponding HTTP Agent model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`).
httpAgentReturnModel.description: This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s).

httpAgentCode.title: The fluent-style method-chaining C# HTTP Agent API code to include where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.
httpAgentCode.description: Prepended to `Operation.HttpAgentCode` where specified to enable standardized functionality.

httpAgentCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom HTTP Agent `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
httpAgentCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

httpAgentMapperBase.title: The HTTP Agent data-layer name that should be used for base mappings.

dataSvcCaching.title: Indicates whether request-based `IRequestCache` caching is to be performed at the `DataSvc` layer to improve performance (i.e. reduce chattiness).

dataSvcCtor.title: The access modifier for the generated `DataSvc` constructor.

dataSvcCustom.title: The option that indicates the level of `DataSvc` customization (invokes `*OnImplementationAsync` method) vs code-generation (automatically invokes data-layer).
dataSvcCustom.description: `Full` indicates the logic is fully customized (only invocation is code-generated). `Partial` indicates combination of surrounding code-generation with final custom invocation versus data-layer. `None` indicates data-layer invocation with _no_ custom invocation (default).

dataSvcCtorCustom.title: Indicates whether the `DataSvc` constructor will be implemented as custom; i.e. not generated.

dataSvcCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-inferred) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated `DataSvc` constructor.
dataSvcCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. Where the `Type` matches an already inferred value it will be ignored.

dataSvcExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `DataSvc` extensions logic should be generated.

eventPublish.title: The layer to add logic to publish an event for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.EventPublish` configuration property (inherits) where not specified. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventGrid, Service Broker, SignalR, etc. This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s).

eventSource.title: The Event Source.
eventSource.description: Defaults to `Name` (as lowercase) appended with the `/{$key}` placeholder. Note: when used in code-generation the `CodeGeneration.EventSourceRoot` will be prepended where specified. To include the entity id/key include a `{$key}` placeholder (`Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation only); for example: `person/{$key}`. This can be overridden for the `Operation`.

eventTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated whereever generating event publishing logic.
eventTransaction.description: Usage will force a rollback of any underlying data transaction (where the provider supports TransactionScope) on failure, such as an `EventPublish` error. This is by no means implying a Distributed Transaction (DTC) should be invoked; this is only intended for a single data source that supports a TransactionScope to guarantee reliable event publishing. Defaults to `CodeGeneration.EventTransaction`. This essentially defaults the `Operation.DataSvcTransaction` where not otherwise specified. This should only be used where a transactionally-aware data source is being used.

managerCustom.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` logic is a custom implementation; i.e. no auto-`DataSvc` invocation logic is to be generated.

managerCtor.title: The access modifier for the generated `Manager` constructor.

managerCtorCustom.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` constructor will be implemented as custom; i.e. not generated.

managerCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-inferred) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated `Manager` constructor.
managerCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. Where the `Type` matches an already inferred value it will be ignored.

managerExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` extensions logic should be generated.

validator.title: The name of the .NET implementing `Type` or interface `Type` that will perform the validation.
validator.description: Only used for defaulting the `Create` and `Update` operation types (`Operation.Type`) where not specified explicitly.

identifierGenerator.title: Indicates whether the `IIdentifierGenerator` should be used to generate the `Id` property where the operation types (`Operation.Type`) is `Create`.

managerCleanUp.title: Indicates whether a `Cleaner.Cleanup` is performed for the operation parameters within the Manager-layer.
managerCleanUp.description: This can be overridden within the `CodeGeneration` and `Operation`(s).

validationFramework.title: The `Validation` framework to use for the entity-based validation.
validationFramework.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.ValidationFramework`. This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s) and `Parameter`(s).

webApiRoutePrefix.title: The `RoutePrefixAtttribute` for the corresponding entity Web API controller.
webApiRoutePrefix.description: This is the base (prefix) `URI` for the entity and can be further extended when defining the underlying `Operation`(s). The `CodeGeneration.WebApiRoutePrefix` will be prepended where specified. Where not specified will automatically default to the pluralized `Name` (as lowercase).

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.WebApiAuthorize` configuration property (inherits) where not specified; can be overridden at the `Operation` level also.

webApiCtor.title: The access modifier for the generated Web API `Controller` constructor.

webApiCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-inferred) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated `WebApi` constructor.
webApiCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred. Where the `Type` matches an already inferred value it will be ignored.

webApiAutoLocation.title: Indicates whether the HTTP Response Location Header route (`Operation.WebApiLocation`) is automatically inferred.
webApiAutoLocation.description: This will automatically set the `Operation.WebApiLocation` for an `Operation` named `Create` where there is a corresponding named `Get`. This is defaulted from the `CodeGen.WebApiAutoLocation`.

webApiConcurrency.title: Indicates whether the Web API is responsible for managing (simulating) concurrency via auto-generated ETag.
webApiConcurrency.description: This provides an alternative where the underlying data source does not natively support optimistic concurrency (native support should always be leveraged as a priority). Where the `Operation.Type` is `Update` or `Patch`, the request ETag will be matched against the response for a corresponding `Get` operation to verify no changes have been made prior to updating. For this to function correctly the .NET response Type for the `Get` must be the same as that returned from the corresponding `Create`, `Update` and `Patch` (where applicable) as the generated ETag is a SHA256 hash of the resulting JSON. This defaults the `Operation.WebApiConcurrency`.

webApiGetOperation.title: The corresponding `Get` method name (in the `XxxManager`) where the `Operation.Type` is `Update` and `SimulateConcurrency` is `true`.
webApiGetOperation.description: Defaults to `Get`. Specify either just the method name (e.g. `OperationName`) or, interface and method name (e.g. `IXxxManager.OperationName`) to be invoked where in a different `YyyManager.OperationName`.

webApiTags.title: The list of tags to add for the generated `WebApi` controller.

dataModel.title: Indicates whether a data `model` version of the entity should also be generated (output to `.\Business\Data\Model`).
dataModel.description: The model will be generated with `OmitEntityBase = true`. Any reference data properties will be defined using their `RefDataType` intrinsic `Type` versus their corresponding (actual) reference data `Type`.

dataModelInherits.title: Overrides the default data `model` inherits value.

excludeEntity.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `Entity` class (`Xxx.cs`).

excludeAll.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of all `Operation` related artefacts; excluding the `Entity` class.
excludeAll.description: Is a shorthand means for setting all of the other `Exclude*` properties (with the exception of `ExcludeEntity`) to exclude.

excludeIData.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `Data` interface (`IXxxData.cs`).

excludeData.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Data` class (`XxxData.cs`).
excludeData.description: Defaults to `Include` indicating _not_ to exclude. A value of `Exclude` indicates to exclude all output; alternatively, `RequiresMapper` indicates to at least output the corresponding `Mapper` class.

excludeIDataSvc.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `DataSvc` interface (`IXxxDataSvc.cs`).

excludeDataSvc.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `DataSvc` class (`XxxDataSvc.cs`).

excludeIManager.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `Manager` interface (`IXxxManager.cs`).

excludeManager.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the `Manager` class (`XxxManager.cs`).

excludeWebApi.title: The option to exclude the generation of the WebAPI `Controller` class (`XxxController.cs`).

excludeWebApiAgent.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the WebAPI consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`).

excludeGrpcAgent.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the gRPC consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`).

authPermission.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsAuthorized(AuthPermission)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

authEntity.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsAuthorized(AuthEntity, AuthAction)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

authRole.title: The role (permission) used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsInRole(role)` for each `Operation`.
authRole.description: Used where not overridden specifically for an `Operation`; i.e. acts as the default.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required for the Entity.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model (see `CodeGeneration.Grpc` configuration); therefore, each corresponding `Property` and `Operation` will also need to be opted-in specifically.

Property.title: 'Property' object (entity-driven)
Property.description: The `Property` object defines an `Entity` property and its charateristics.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. Depending on whether the `Type` is `bool`, will appear in one of the two generated sentences. Where not `bool` it will be: Gets or sets a value indicating whether {text}.'. Otherwise, it will be: Gets or sets the {text}.'. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

modelText.title: The overriding model text for use in comments.
modelText.description: By default the `ModelText` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. Depending on whether the `Type` is `bool`, will appear in one of the two generated sentences. Where not `bool` it will be: Gets or sets a value indicating whether {text}.'. Otherwise, it will be: Gets or sets the {text}.'. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

type.title: The .NET `Type`.
type.description: Defaults to `string`. To reference a Reference Data `Type` always prefix with `RefDataNamespace` (e.g. `RefDataNamespace.Gender`) or shortcut `^` (e.g. `^Gender`). This will ensure that the appropriate Reference Data `using` statement is used. _Shortcut:_ Where the `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.` or `^`, and the correspondong `RefDataType` attribute is not specified it will automatically default the `RefDataType` to `string.`

nullable.title: Indicates whether the .NET `Type` should be declared as nullable; e.g. `string?`. Will be inferred where the `Type` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`.

inherited.title: Indicates whether the property is inherited and therefore should not be output within the generated Entity class.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

primaryKey.title: Indicates whether the property is considered part of the primary (unique) key.
primaryKey.description: This is also used to simplify the parameter specification for an Entity Operation by inferrence.

isEntity.title: Indicates that the property `Type` is another generated entity / collection and therefore specific capabilities can be assumed (e.g. `CopyFrom` and `Clone`).
isEntity.description: Will be inferred (default to `true`) where the `Type` is `ChangeLog` or the `Type` is found as another `Entity` within the code-generation configuration file.

immutable.title: Indicates that the value is immutable and therefore cannot be changed once set.

dateTimeTransform.title: The `DateTime` transformation to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
dateTimeTransform.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `DateTime`.

stringTrim.title: The `string` trimming of white space characters to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
stringTrim.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `string`.

stringTransform.title: The `string` transformation to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
stringTransform.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `string`.

stringCasing.title: The `string` casing to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
stringCasing.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `string`.

autoCreate.title: Indicates whether an instance of the `Type` is to be automatically created/instantiated when the property is first accessed (i.e. lazy instantiation).

default.title: The C# code to default the value.
default.description: Where the `Type` is `string` then the specified default value will need to be delimited. Any valid value assignment C# code can be used.

partitionKey.title: Indicates whether the property is considered part of the Partition Key.
partitionKey.description: This will implement `IPartitionKey` for the generated entity.

cacheKey.title: Indicates whether the property is considered part of the Cache Key.
cacheKey.description: This will implement `ICacheKey` for the generated entity.

internalOnly.title: Indicates whether the property is for internal use only; declared in Business entities only.
internalOnly.description: In this instance the `Property` will be excluded from the `Common` entity declaration and `Business` JSON serialization.

refDataType.title: The underlying Reference Data Type that is also used as the Reference Data serialization identifier (SID).
refDataType.description: Defaults to `string` (being the `ReferenceDataBase.Code`) where not specified and the corresponding `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.` or `^`. Note: an `Id` of type `string` is currently not supported; the use of the `Code` is the recommended approach.

refDataList.title: Indicates that the Reference Data property is to be a serializable list (`ReferenceDataSidList`).
refDataList.description: This is required to enable a list of Reference Data values (as per `RefDataType`) to be passed as an argument for example.

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data property, overriding the `Entity.RefDataText` selection.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API `Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`).`Optional` indicates when `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` then a value is output, `Always` indicates that the value is _always_ output, and `Never` indicates that feature is turned off.

refDataTextName.title: The corresponding reference data `Text` property name; defaults to `Name` + 'Text'.

refDataMapping.title: Indicates whether the property should use the underlying Reference Data mapping capabilities.
refDataMapping.description: Mapped properties are a special Reference Data property type that ensure value uniqueness; this allows the likes of additional to/from mappings to occur between systems where applicable.

jsonName.title: The JSON property name.
jsonName.description: Defaults to `ArgumentName` where not specified (i.e. camelCase); however, where the property is `ETag` it will default to the `Config.ETagJsonName`.

jsonDataModelName.title: The JSON property name for the corresponding data model (see `Entity.DataModel`).

serializationIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property is not to be serialized.
serializationIgnore.description: All properties are serialized by default.

serializationAlwaysInclude.title: Indicates whether to include the value (default or otherwise) when serializing.

dataModelIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property is to be included within the data model.
dataModelIgnore.description: All properties are included in the data model by default.

dataModelSerializationIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property is not to be serialized where outputting as a data model.
dataModelSerializationIgnore.description: All properties are included in the data model by default.

dataName.title: The data name where Entity.AutoImplement is selected.
dataName.description: Defaults to the property `Name`. Represents the column name for a `Database`, or the correspinding property name for the other options.

dataConverter.title: The data `Converter` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
dataConverter.description: A `Converter` is used to convert a data source value to/from a .NET `Type` where no standard data conversion can be applied. Where this value is suffixed by `<T>` or `{T}` this will automatically set `Type`.

dataMapperIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the `Data`-layer / data `Mapper` generated output.
dataMapperIgnore.description: All properties are included by default.

dataAutoGenerated.title: Indicates whether the `PrimaryKey` property value is automatically generated by the data source on `Create`.

dataOperationTypes.title: The operations types (`ExecutionContext.OperationType`) selection to enable inclusion and exclusion of property mapping.

databaseMapper.title: The database property `Mapper` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
databaseMapper.description: A `Mapper` is used to map a data source value to/from a .NET complex `Type` (i.e. class with one or more properties).

databaseIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the database `Mapper` generated output.

databaseDbType.title: The database `DbType` override (versus inferring from the corresponding .NET Type).
databaseDbType.description: Overrides the inferred database type; i.e. can specify `Date` or `DateTime2`, for .NET Type `System.DateTime`.

entityFrameworkMapper.title: The Entity Framework `Mapper` approach for the property.

cosmosMapper.title: The Cosmos `Mapper` approach for the property.

odataMapper.title: The OData `Mapper` approach for the property.
odataMapper.description: Defaults to `Map` which indicates the property will be explicitly mapped. A value of `Ignore` will explicitly `Ignore`, whilst a value of `Skip` will skip code-generated mapping altogether.

httpAgentMapper.title: The HttpAgent `Mapper` approach for the property.

displayName.title: The display name used in the likes of error messages for the property.
displayName.description: Defaults to the `Name` as sentence case.

annotation1.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

annotation2.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

annotation3.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

grpcFieldNo.title: The unique (immutable) field number required to enable gRPC support.

grpcType.title: The underlying gRPC data type; will be inferred where not specified.

Operation.title: 'CodeGeneration' object (entity-driven)
Operation.description: The code generation for an `Operation` is primarily driven by the `Type` property. This encourages (enforces) a consistent implementation for the standardised **CRUD** (Create, Read, Update and Delete) actions, as well as supporting fully customised operations as required.

type.title: The type of operation that is to be code-generated.

text.title: The text for use in comments.
text.description: The `Text` will be defaulted for all the `Operation.Type` options with the exception of `Custom`. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

primaryKey.title: Indicates whether the properties marked as a primary key (`Property.PrimaryKey`) are to be used as the parameters.
primaryKey.description: This simplifies the specification of these properties as parameters versus having to declare each specifically. Each of the parameters will also be set to be mandatory.

paging.title: Indicates whether a `PagingArgs` argument is to be added to the operation to enable (standardized) paging related logic.

query.title: Indicates whether a `QueryArgs` argument is to be added to the operation to enable OData-like $filter and $orderby related logic.

valueType.title: The .NET value parameter `Type` for the operation.
valueType.description: Defaults to the parent `Entity.Name` where the `Operation.Type` options are `Create` or `Update`.

returnType.title: The .NET return `Type` for the operation.
returnType.description: Defaults to the parent `Entity.Name` where the `Operation.Type` options are `Get`, `GetColl`, `Create` or `Update`; otherwise, defaults to `void`.

returnTypeNullable.title: Indicates whether the `ReturnType` is nullable for the operation.
returnTypeNullable.description: Will be inferred where the `ReturnType` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`. Additionally a `Type` of `Get` will default to `true` where not specified.

returnText.title: The text for use in comments to describe the `ReturnType`.
returnText.description: A default will be created where not specified. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private usage. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `GetByArgs` as `_getByArgs`.

withResult.title: Indicates whether to use `CoreEx.Results` (aka Railway-oriented programming).

autoImplement.title: The operation override for the `Entity.AutoImplement`.
autoImplement.description: Defaults to `Entity.AutoImplement`. The corresponding `Entity.AutoImplement` must be defined for this to be enacted. Auto-implementation is applicable for all `Operation.Type` options with the exception of `Custom`.

dataEntityMapper.title: The override for the data entity `Mapper`.
dataEntityMapper.description: Used where the default generated `Mapper` is not applicable.

dataExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Data` extensions logic should be generated.

dataInvoker.title: Indicates whether a `DataInvoker` should orchestrate the `Data`-layer.
dataInvoker.description: Where `Dataransaction` or `EventPublish` is `Data` then orchestration will default to `true`.

dataTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `Data`-layer.
dataTransaction.description: Where using an `EventOutbox` this is ignored as it is implied through its usage.

databaseStoredProc.title: The database stored procedure name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database`.

entityFrameworkModel.title: The corresponding Entity Framework model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`).

cosmosModel.title: The corresponding Cosmos model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`).

cosmosContainerId.title: The Cosmos `ContainerId` override used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

cosmosPartitionKey.title: The C# code override to be used for setting the optional Cosmos `PartitionKey` used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

odataCollectionName.title: The override name of the underlying OData collection where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataCollectionName.description: Overriddes the `Entity.ODataCollectionName`; otherwise, the underlying `Simple.OData.Client` will attempt to infer.

httpAgentRoute.title: The HTTP Agent API route where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.

httpAgentMethod.title: The HTTP Agent Method for the operation.

httpAgentModel.title: The corresponding HTTP Agent model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`).
httpAgentModel.description: This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s).

httpAgentReturnModel.title: The corresponding HTTP Agent model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`).
httpAgentReturnModel.description: Defaults to `Operation.HttpAgentModel` where the `Operation.ReturnType` is equal to `Entity.Name` (same type). This can be overridden within the `Operation`(s).

httpAgentCode.title: The fluent-style method-chaining C# HTTP Agent API code to include where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `HttpAgent`.
httpAgentCode.description: Appended to `Entity.HttpAgentCode` where specified to extend.

managerCustom.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` logic is a custom implementation; i.e. no auto-`DataSvc` invocation logic is to be generated.

managerTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `Manager`-layer.

managerExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` extensions logic should be generated.

validator.title: The name of the .NET implementing `Type` or interface `Type` that will perform the validation.
validator.description: Defaults to the `Entity.Validator` where not specified explicitly (where `Operation.Type` options `Create` or `Update`).

validationFramework.title: The `Validation` framework to use for the entity-based validation.
validationFramework.description: Defaults to `Entity.ValidationFramework`. This can be overridden within the `Parameter`(s).

managerOperationType.title: The `ExecutionContext.OperationType` (CRUD denotation) defined at the `Manager`-layer.
managerOperationType.description: The default will be inferred from the `Operation.Type`; however, where the `Operation.Type` is `Custom` it will default to `Unspecified`.

managerCleanUp.title: Indicates whether a `Cleaner.Cleanup` is performed for the operation parameters within the Manager-layer.
managerCleanUp.description: This can be overridden within the `CodeGeneration` and `Entity`.

dataSvcCustom.title: The option that indicates the level of `DataSvc` customization (invokes `*OnImplementationAsync` method) vs code-generation (automatically invokes data-layer).
dataSvcCustom.description: `Full` indicates the logic is fully customized (only invocation is code-generated). `Partial` indicates combination of surrounding code-generation with final custom invocation versus data-layer. `None` indicates data-layer invocation with _no_ custom invocation (default).

dataSvcTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `DataSvc`-layer.

dataSvcInvoker.title: Indicates whether a `DataSvcInvoker` should orchestrate the `DataSvc`-layer.
dataSvcInvoker.description: Where `DataSvcTransaction` or `EventPublish` is `DataSvc` then the orchestration will default to `true`.

dataSvcExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `DataSvc` extensions logic should be generated.

eventPublish.title: The layer to add logic to publish an event for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to the `Entity.EventPublish` configuration property (inherits) where not specified. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventGrid, Service Broker, SignalR, etc.

eventValue.title: The event value override as C# code (is used as-is).
eventValue.description: The event value is automatically inferred where the `Operation.Type` is `Create`, `Update` or  `Delete`.

eventSource.title: The Event Source.
eventSource.description: Defaults to `Entity.EventSource`. Note: when used in code-generation the `CodeGeneration.EventSourceRoot` will be prepended where specified. To include the entity id/key include a `{$key}` placeholder (`Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation only); for example: `person/{$key}`. Otherwise, specify the C# string interpolation expression; for example: `person/{r.Id}`.

eventSubject.title: The event subject template and corresponding event action pair (separated by a colon).
eventSubject.description: The event subject template defaults to `{AppName}.{Entity.Name}`, plus each of the unique key placeholders comma separated; e.g. `Domain.Entity.{id1},{id2}` (depending on whether `Entity.EventSubjectFormat` is `NameAndKey` or `NameOnly`). The event action defaults to `WebApiOperationType` or `Operation.Type` where not specified. Multiple events can be raised by specifying more than one subject/action pair separated by a semicolon. E.g. `Demo.Person.{id}:Create;Demo.Other.{id}:Update`.

webApiRoute.title: The Web API `RouteAtttribute` to be appended to the `Entity.WebApiRoutePrefix`.
webApiRoute.description: Where the value is specified with a leading `!` character this indicates that the `Entity.WebApiRoutePrefix` should not be used, and the value should be used as-is (with the `!` removed).

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: Where not specified no attribute output will occur; it will then inherit as supported by .NET.

webApiMethod.title: The HTTP Method for the operation.
webApiMethod.description: The value defaults as follows: `HttpGet` for `Operation.Type` value `Get` or `GetColl`, `HttpPost` for `Operation.Type` value `Create` or `Custom`, `HttpPut` for `Operation.Type` value `Update`, and `HttpDelete` for `Operation.Type` value `Delete`. An `Operation.Type` value `Patch` can not be specified and will always default to `HttpPatch`.

webApiStatus.title: The primary HTTP Status Code that will be returned for the operation where there is a non-`null` return value.
webApiStatus.description: The value defaults as follows: `OK` for `Operation.Type` value `Get`, `GetColl`, `Update`, `Delete` or `Custom`, `Created` for `Operation.Type` value `Create`.

webApiAlternateStatus.title: The primary HTTP Status Code that will be returned for the operation where there is a `null` return value.
webApiAlternateStatus.description: The value defaults as follows: `NotFound` for `Operation.Type` of `Get`, `Update`, `Patch`; `NoContent` for `Operation.Type` of `GetColl`; otherwise, `none`. A value of `none` indicates that there is _no_ alternate status.

webApiLocation.title: The HTTP Response Location Header route.
webApiLocation.description: This uses similar formatting to the `WebApiRoute`. The response value is accessed using `r.` notation to access underlying properties; for example `{r.Id}` or `person/{r.Id}`. The `Entity.WebApiRoutePrefix` will be prepended automatically; however, to disable set the first character to `!`, e.g. `!person/{r.Id}`. The URI can be inferred from another `Operation` by using a lookup `^`; for example `^Get` indicates to infer from the named `Get` operation (where only `^` is specified this is shorthand for `^Get` as this is the most common value). The Location URI will ensure the first character is a `/` so it acts a 'relative URL absolute path'.

webApiConcurrency.title: Indicates whether the Web API is responsible for managing (simulating) concurrency via auto-generated ETag.
webApiConcurrency.description: This provides an alternative where the underlying data source does not natively support optimistic concurrency (native support should always be leveraged as a priority). Where the `Operation.Type` is `Update` or `Patch`, the request ETag will be matched against the response for a corresponding `Get` operation to verify no changes have been made prior to updating. For this to function correctly the .NET response Type for the `Get` must be the same as that returned from the corresponding `Create`, `Update` and `Patch` (where applicable) as the generated ETag is a SHA256 hash of the resulting JSON. Defaults to `Entity.WebApiConcurrency`.

webApiGetOperation.title: The corresponding `Get` method name (in the `XxxManager`) where the `Operation.Type` is `Update` and `SimulateConcurrency` is `true`.
webApiGetOperation.description: Defaults to `Get`. Specify either just the method name (e.g. `OperationName`) or, interface and method name (e.g. `IXxxManager.OperationName`) to be invoked where in a different `YyyManager.OperationName`.

webApiUpdateOperation.title: The corresponding `Update` method name (in the `XxxManager`) where the `Operation.Type` is `Patch`.
webApiUpdateOperation.description: Defaults to `Update`. Specify either just the method name (e.g. `OperationName`) or, interface and method name (e.g. `IXxxManager.OperationName`) to be invoked where in a different `YyyManager.OperationName`.

webApiProduces.title: The value(s) for the optional `[Produces()]` attribute for the operation within the Web Api Controller for the Swagger/OpenAPI documentation.

webApiProducesResponseType.title: The `[ProducesResponseType()]` attribute `typeof` for the operation within the Web Api Controller for the Swagger/OpenAPI documentation.
webApiProducesResponseType.description: Defaults to the _Common_ type. A value of `None`, `none` or `` will ensure no type is emitted.

webApiTags.title: The list of tags to add for the generated `WebApi` operation.
webApiTags.description: Overrides the `Entity.WebApiTags`; unless, if the first tag value is a `^` then this indicates that the `Entity.WebApiTags` are to be included (inherited) as a replacement. Otherwise, defaults to `Entity.WebApiTags`.

authPermission.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsAuthorized(AuthPermission)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

authEntity.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsAuthorized(AuthEntity, AuthAction)` to determine whether the user is authorized. Defaults to `Entity.AuthEntity`. Both the `AuthEntity` and `AuthAction` are required for code-generation.

authAction.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsAuthorized(AuthEntity, AuthAction)` to determine whether the user is authorized. Both the `AuthEntity` and `AuthAction` are required for code-generation.

authRole.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.UserIsInRole(AuthRole)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

excludeAll.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of all `Operation` related output.
excludeAll.description: Is a shorthand means for setting all of the other `Exclude*` properties to `true`.

excludeIData.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Data` interface (`IXxxData.cs`) output.

excludeData.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Data` class (`XxxData.cs`) output.

excludeIDataSvc.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `DataSvc` interface (`IXxxDataSvc.cs`) output.

excludeDataSvc.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `DataSvc` class (`XxxDataSvc.cs`) output.

excludeIManager.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Manager` interface (`IXxxManager.cs`) output.

excludeManager.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Manager` class (`XxxManager.cs`) output.

excludeWebApi.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the WebAPI `Controller` class (`XxxController.cs`) output.

excludeWebApiAgent.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the WebAPI consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`) output.

excludeGrpcAgent.title: Indicates whether to exclude the generation of the operation within the gRPC consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`) output.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required for the Operation.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model (see `CodeGeneration.Grpc` configuration); therefore, each corresponding `Entity`, `Property` and `Operation` will also need to be opted-in specifically.

Parameter.title: 'Parameter' object (entity-driven)
Parameter.description: The `Parameter` object defines an `Operation` parameter and its charateristics.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

type.title: The .NET `Type`.
type.description: Defaults to `string`. To reference a Reference Data `Type` always prefix with `RefDataNamespace` (e.g. `RefDataNamespace.Gender`) or shortcut `^` (e.g. `^Gender`). This will ensure that the appropriate Reference Data `using` statement is used. _Shortcut:_ Where the `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.` or `^`, and the correspondong `RefDataType` attribute is not specified it will automatically default the `RefDataType` to `string.`

nullable.title: Indicates whether the .NET Type should be declared as nullable; e.g. `int?`. Will be inferred where the `Type` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`. Where the .NET Type is not considered as an intrinsic type then will default to `true`.

default.title: The C# code to default the value.
default.description: Where the `Type` is `string` then the specified default value will need to be delimited. Any valid value assignment C# code can be used.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

property.title: The `Property.Name` within the parent `Entity` to copy (set) the configuration/characteristics from where not already defined.

refDataType.title: The underlying Reference Data Type that is also used as the Reference Data serialization identifier (SID).
refDataType.description: Defaults to `string` where not specified and the corresponding `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.`.

refDataList.title: Indicates that the Reference Data property is to be a serializable list (`ReferenceDataSidList`).
refDataList.description: This is required to enable a list of Reference Data values (as per `RefDataType`) to be passed as an argument for example.

validator.title: The name of the .NET `Type` that will perform the validation.

validatorCode.title: The fluent-style method-chaining C# validator code to append to `IsMandatory` and `Validator` (where specified).

validationFramework.title: The `Validation` framework to use for the entity-based validation.

isMandatory.title: Indicates whether a `ValidationException` should be thrown when the parameter value has its default value (null, zero, etc).

layerPassing.title: The option that determines the layers in which the parameter is passed.
layerPassing.description: Defaults to `All`. To further describe, `All` passes the parameter through all layeys, `ToManagerSet` only passes the parameter to the `Manager` layer and overrides the same named property within the corresponding `value` parameter, `ToManagerCollSet` only passes the parameter to the `Manager` layer and overrides the same named property within the corresponding `value` collection parameter. Where using the `PrimaryKey` option to automatically set `Parameters`, and the `Operation.Type` is `Create` or `Update` it will default to `ToManagerSet`.

dataConverter.title: The data `Converter` class name where specific data conversion is required.
dataConverter.description: A `Converter` is used to convert a data source value to/from a .NET `Type` where no standard data conversion can be applied. Where this value is suffixed by `<T>` or `{T}` this will automatically set `Type`.

webApiFrom.title: The option for how the parameter will be delcared within the Web API Controller.
webApiFrom.description: Defaults to `FromQuery`; unless the parameter `Type` has also been defined as an `Entity` within the code-gen config file then it will default to `FromEntityProperties`. Specifies that the parameter will be declared with corresponding `FromQueryAttribute`, `FromBodyAttribute` or `FromRouteAttribute` for the Web API method. The `FromEntityProperties` will declare all properties of the `Entity` as query parameters.An `AcceptsBody` indicates that the _value_ will be passed in the HTTP Request Body and be handled (JSON deserialized) as a `CoreEx.AspNetCore.WebApis.WebWebApiParam` (default behavior for a `Create` or `Update` operation type).

webApiText.title: The overriding text for use in the Web API comments.
webApiText.description: By default the `WbeApiText` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.

grpcType.title: The underlying gRPC data type; will be inferred where not specified.

Const.title: 'Const' object (entity-driven)
Const.description: The `Const` object is used to define a .NET (C#) constant value for an `Entity`.

value.title: The .NET (C#) code for the constant value.
value.description: The code generation will ensure the value is delimited properly to output correctly formed (delimited) .NET (C#) code.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. It will be formatted as: `Represents a {text} constant value.` To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. `{{Xxx}}`). To have the text used as-is prefix with a `+` plus-sign character.
